Problem identified: Fecal coliforms, total coliforms, Sodium and chloride(salt)
Description: Fecal coliforms indicate the presence of pathogens in water which may impose health risk like dysentery, typhoid fever, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain.Fairly high level of sodium and chloride (Salts) affect taste and may cause hypertension.
Treatment option: Boil this water before consumption or use tablets like water guard before consumption or vigorously shake the water in a transparent container like a clear soft drink bottle and expose it to full sunlight for at least 6 hours, for example on the roof, before consumption.People should moderate their salt intake from other sources if their drinking water is relatively salty

Problem identified: Nitrate, Fecal coliforms and Total coliforms
Description: Fecal coliforms indicate the presence of pathogens in water which may impose health risk like dysentery, typhoid fever, diarrhea, vomiting, abdominal pain.High Nitrate levels can lead to blue-baby syndrome in infants
Treatment option: This water is not suitable for drinking/cooking/meal preparation. Use only for cleaning and gardening.

Problem identified: May get contaminated with bacteria during roof collection and storage
Description: May get contaminated with bacteria during roof collection and storage
Treatment option: Rainwater is safe for consumption, but may get contaminated during roof collection and storage. It would be prudent to boil this water before consumption or use tablets like water guard before consumption or vigorously shake the water in a transparent container like a clear soft drink bottle and expose it to full sunlight for at least 6 hours, for example on the roof, before consumption.
